titleStmt.title: John H. Cashman to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2375

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: Dear sir I am informed that you have the appointing of both the ^tobaco^ Ispectors in Louisville and as I desire my claims to be consideed I wish your favors to be extended to me as our friends in Gov= of Kyhas had great advantages Over the Cuntry in the tobacco trade I hope you will if I can satisfy you that I am all right, I have been in the tobacco trade for some time and i know the duties of the inpectors business I think verry well and have a large family to support and somewhat behind I dont think by what I have heard of you that you will deny me -- when all the facts are made known, so give me some good news, I intend to come and see you yours &c -- Louisville
N B I can get lots of petitioners to satisfy you of qualification and integrity

J. H Cashman
Inspector of Tob
